purpleculture_pinyin:
yú
extra; surplus; remaining; remainder after division; (following numerical value) or more; in excess of (some number); residue (math.); after; I; me; surname Yu; variant of 余 , remainder
дополнительный; избыток; осталось; остаток после деления; (после числового значения) или более; сверх (некоторое количество); остаток (математ.); после; Я; мне; фамилия Ю; вариант 余, остаток
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 余)
Antonyms: 虧
Ideographic: Extra 余 food 飠; 余 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
餘額 [ yú é ]: balance (of an account, bill etc); surplus; remainder
餘地 [ yú dì ]: margin; leeway
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right

    • 余 [ yú ] surplus, remainder; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: At the supermarket the cashier forgets to take off the previous customer's food from the scale, so I tell her that the weight is in excess.
Ru_trainchinese:
yú: (глаг/местоим) оставаться, быть в остатке; (устар.) я
yú: (графема) свободное время (напр., от работы); остаток, излишек
yú: (число) больше, с лишним, свыше
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: At the supermarket the cashier forgets to take off the previous customer's food from the scale, so I tell her that the weight is in excess.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " food " to " yu " sound. It means extra and remaining. "Guang Ya. Interpretation IV": "Yu, Yingye." "Yu Pian. Food Department: "Yu, Can Ye." The extra part, if it is not needed in terms of function, can be regarded as residual, so the two meanings are actually the same. Examples of extra meanings are like "The Analects. "Study Er": "If you have extra energy in your line, you can learn literature." Han Yu of the Tang Dynasty (Answer to Mengjiao): "Everyone is left with wine and meat, but the son is not full." Lao Tzu. Chapter Seventy-seven": "The Way of the Heavens damages more than makes up for the deficiencies." "Book of Rites. "Tan Gong Shang": "Funerals, instead of mourning inadequately, there is more than mourning, not if there is insufficient ceremonies and more than mourning." "Guan Zi. Number of Lands": "In the past, Jie Ba had the world and was under-utilized. The soup was seventy li thin and over-used."

" Yu " means residual meaning, such as "Shangshu. "Kang Gao": "Wang Cheng cuts Guan Shu Cai Shu, and Yin Yumin named Kang Shu." "Zuo Zhuan. Zhuanggong Sixth Year: "People will not eat me." "Warring States. "Zhao Cesan": "Qin's attack on me, spare no effort, and will return with fatigue."

" Yu " extended to mean abundance and wealth. Such as "Zhuangzi. "Maintaining Health": "Into the room with no thickness, there must be room for recovery." "Warring States. Qin Ce Fifth": "Today Li Tian is ready to work, no warm clothes and more food." "Huainanzi. "Spirit": "The saint's food is enough to catch his breath, and his clothes are enough to cover his shape, and he doesn't want more than a feeling."

" Remainder " means the number of zeros and the remainder of zero other than integers. "Zhengzitong": "Yu, abnormal." Such as "Book of Rites. "Tan Gongxia": "There are more than seventy people in the Jin Dynasty's management and treasury, but they don't pay for their lives, and their deaths do not belong to his son Yan." "Warring States. "Qi Ce Six": "Swallows attack Qi and take more than seventy cities, but Ju and Jimo can't get it." "Han. "The Biography of Wei Qinghuo Qubing": "The general Qing Gong led the soldiers, and the teacher was a great victory. He won more than ten people from the Xiongnu King and gained 8,700 households."

" Yu " means other and outside. Such as "The Spring and Autumn Rampage. "The Five Years of Yin Gong": "The three emperors are called the public, the king is called the public afterwards, the other big nations are called the princes, and the small nations are called uncle, son, and man." "Historical Records. "Benji of the Great Ancestor": "Agreement with Father and Elder, three chapters of the law: the murderer died, the wounded, and the thief settled the crime, I learned that the Qin law was removed."

" Yu " also means slight end, as in "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Guisheng": "From this perspective, the merits of the emperor and the rest of the saint are not the only way to maintain one's health." He Xiu of the Han Dynasty, "The Spring and Autumn Gongyang Notes. "Preface": "Hate that the first teacher can't listen to it, but often follow the two creations. In the rest of this world, is it not a matter of keeping the text and the failure?"
humanum_short_description_en: From " food " to " yu " sound. It means extra and remaining.
humanum_full_description:
從「食」，「余」聲。表示多出來的、殘留的。《廣雅．釋詁四》：「餘，盈也。」《玉篇．食部》：「餘，殘也。」多出來的部分，從功用上來說如果是不需要的，即可視為殘留，故兩義其實相通。表示多出來之義的例子如《論語．學而》：「行有餘力，則以學文。」唐代韓愈〈答孟郊〉：「人皆餘酒肉，子獨不得飽。」古書中常以「有餘」和「不足」相對，如《老子．七十七章》：「天之道，損有餘而補不足。」《禮記．檀弓上》：「喪禮，與其哀不足而禮有餘也，不若禮不足而哀有餘也。」《管子．地數》：「昔者桀霸有天下而用不足，湯有七十里之薄而用有餘。」

　　「餘」表示殘留義的例子如《尚書．康誥》：「成王既伐管叔蔡叔，以殷餘民封康叔。」《左傳．莊公六年》：「人將不食吾餘。」《戰國策．趙策三》：「秦之攻我也，不遺餘力矣，必以倦而歸也。」

　　「餘」引申表示豐足、寬裕。如《莊子．養生主》：「以無厚入有間，恢恢乎其於遊刃必有餘地矣。」《戰國策．秦策五》：「今力田疾作，不得煖衣餘食。」《淮南子．精神》：「聖人食足以接氣，衣足以蓋形，適情不求餘。」

　　「餘」表示整數以外的零數、零餘。《正字通》：「餘，畸也。」如《禮記．檀弓下》：「所舉於晉國管庫之士七十有餘家，生不交利，死不屬其子焉。」《戰國策．齊策六》：「燕攻齊，取七十餘城，唯莒、即墨不下。」《漢書．衛青霍去病傳》：「大將軍青躬率戎士，師大捷，獲匈奴王十有餘人，益封青八千七百戶。」

　　「餘」表示其他的、以外的。如《春秋公羊傳．隱公五年》：「天子三公稱公，王者之後稱公，其餘大國稱侯，小國稱伯、子、男。」《史記．高祖本紀》：「與父老約，法三章耳：殺人者死，傷人及盜抵罪，餘悉除去秦法。」

　　「餘」亦表示微末，如《呂氏春秋．貴生》：「由此觀之，帝王之功，聖人之餘事也，非所以完身養生之道也。」漢代何休《春秋公羊注疏．序》：「恨先師觀聽不決，多隨二創，此世之餘事，斯豈非守文持論，敗績失據之過哉！」徐彥疏：「餘，末也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「食」，「余」聲。表示多出來的、殘留的。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
餘 (Simplified: 余)
Pinyin: yú
English Definition: extra; surplus; remaining; remainder after division; (following numerical value) or more; in excess of (some number); residue (math.); after; I; me; surname Yu; variant of 余 , remainder
Antonyms: 虧
Total strokes: 16; Radical: 食
Ideographic: Extra 余 food 飠; 余 also provides the pronunciation
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 飠 [ shí ] food; to eat
    • 余 [ yú ] surplus, remainder; surname
Example Words:
餘額 [ yú é ]: balance (of an account, bill etc); surplus; remainder
餘地 [ yú dì ]: margin; leeway
More: 餘* | *餘 | *餘*

Simplified in Unicode standard 简体字的Unicode标准:U+9980

Main pronunciation 主要发音: yú

Other pronunciations 其它发音: yú,tú,xú,yù

Original meaning 本义: Meaning surplus.

English senses 英语理解: I, my, me; surname; surplus

Usage example 用法举例: 剩餘 shèng yú (surplus) 馀姓 yú xìng (surname) “馀年无多”

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 502

Shuowen 说文解字: 饒也從食余聲

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 餘 from mouth-eating (饣)飠食 shí and phonetic bitter-herb 余 yú (not- 佘 shé) A302 余[餘] simp 余 simp 余 (official) simp 馀 (alternate).

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(- simplification- if there is confusion, in classical Chinese, can use 馀 yú 馀年无多).

Simplification rule : A302 余[餘]

Simplification rule explained :
phonetic-part 余餘 余 (tea, I, name) 馀餘 (surplus food)

Variant rule : C000

Variant rule clarification :

Applied rules :

New font rule :

yu2
HSK 2: 鱼,魚
HSK 3: 于
HSK 4: 与,愉,與
HSK 5: 娛,余,娱,餘
HSK 6: 漁,予,渔,愚,舆,輿
(Simplified: 余)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 虧
Ideographic: Extra 余 food 飠; 余 also provides the pronunciation
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 飠 [ shí ] food; to eat
    • 余 [ yú ] surplus, remainder; surname
①我：“餘將老”。
②剩下來的，多出來的：剩餘。餘糧。餘興。餘悸。餘孽。節餘。餘生。餘蔭(指前人的遺澤，遺留的庇廕)。餘勇可賈(還有剩餘的力量可以使出來)。
③十、百、千等整數或名數後的零數：十餘人。
④後：“勞動之餘，歡歌笑語。”
⑤代詞。第一人稱代詞，我或我的。
⑥姓氏。
餘額 [ yú é ]: balance (of an account, bill etc); surplus; remainder
餘地 [ yú dì ]: margin; leeway
(Simplified: 余)

Freq: 6507
Chinese: At the supermarket the cashier forgets to take off the previous customer's food from the scale, so I tell her that the weight is in excess.
Meaning: excess
Hanzi: 馀余
Story: At the supermarket the cashier forgets to take off the previous customer's food from the scale, so I tell her that the weight is in excess.
Kind: simplified

從「 食 」，「 余 」聲。表示多出來的、殘留的。《廣雅．釋詁四》：「餘，盈也。」《玉篇．食部》：「餘，殘也。」多出來的部分，從功用上來說如果是不需要的，即可視為殘留，故兩義其實相通。表示多出來之義的例子如《論語．學而》：「行有餘力，則以學文。」唐代韓愈〈答孟郊〉：「人皆餘酒肉，子獨不得飽。」古書中常以「有餘」和「不足」相對，如《老子．七十七章》：「天之道，損有餘而補不足。」《禮記．檀弓上》：「喪禮，與其哀不足而禮有餘也，不若禮不足而哀有餘也。」《管子．地數》：「昔者桀霸有天下而用不足，湯有七十里之薄而用有餘。」 「 餘 」表示殘留義的例子如《尚書．康誥》：「成王既伐管叔蔡叔，以殷餘民封康叔。」《左傳．莊公六年》：「人將不食吾餘。」《戰國策．趙策三》：「秦之攻我也，不遺餘力矣，必以倦而歸也。」 「 餘 」引申表示豐足、寬裕。如《莊子．養生主》：「以無厚入有間，恢恢乎其於遊刃必有餘地矣。」《戰國策．秦策五》：「今力田疾作，不得煖衣餘食。」《淮南子．精神》：「聖人食足以接氣，衣足以蓋形，適情不求餘。」 「 餘 」表示整數以外的零數、零餘。《正字通》：「餘，畸也。」如《禮記．檀弓下》：「所舉於晉國管庫之士七十有餘家，生不交利，死不屬其子焉。」《戰國策．齊策六》：「燕攻齊，取七十餘城，唯莒、即墨不下。」《漢書．衛青霍去病傳》：「大將軍青躬率戎士，師大捷，獲匈奴王十有餘人，益封青八千七百戶。」 「 餘 」表示其他的、以外的。如《春秋公羊傳．隱公五年》：「天子三公稱公，王者之後稱公，其餘大國稱侯，小國稱伯、子、男。」《史記．高祖本紀》：「與父老約，法三章耳：殺人者死，傷人及盜抵罪，餘悉除去秦法。」 「 餘 」亦表示微末，如《呂氏春秋．貴生》：「由此觀之，帝王之功，聖人之餘事也，非所以完身養生之道也。」漢代何休《春秋公羊注疏．序》：「恨先師觀聽不決，多隨二創，此世之餘事，斯豈非守文持論，敗績失據之過哉！」徐彥疏：「餘，末也。」

餘字的基本解释

餘
yú
见“馀”。

餘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yú］
［《廣韻》以諸切，平魚，以。］
“邪3”的被通假字。“馀1”的繁体字。
(1)食物馀剩，多出来。
(2)未尽；不尽；残剩。
(3)丰足；宽裕。
(4)谓超过。
(5)长久。
(6)遗留。
(7)遗漏。
(8)其馀的；其他的。
(9)末；非主要的。
(10)之后；以后。
(11)指后裔。
(12)遗弃。
(13)蓄积。参见“餘一餘三”。
(14)盐。
(15)表示整数后馀计的零头尾数。用于数词或数量词之后。
(16)代词。同“余”。表示第一人称。
(17)通“與”。
(18)姓。春秋吴有馀祭。见《史记·吴太伯世家》。

餘字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【食字部】　餘； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1420第25
【唐韻】以諸切【集韻】【韻會】羊諸切【正韻】雲俱切，?音余。【說文】饒也。【玉篇】殘也。【廣韻】賸也。【周禮·天官·冢宰】以九賦斂財賄。九曰幣餘之賦。【鄭註】百工之餘。【左傳·文元年】歸餘于終。又【孟子】餘夫二十五畝。【註】一夫，上父母，下妻子，以五口八口爲率。如有弟，是餘夫也。　又【周禮·地官·小司徒】凡國之大事，致民。大故，致餘子。【註】餘謂羡也。鄭康成謂：餘子卿大夫之子，當守於王宮者也。【左傳·宣二年】又宦其餘子。【註】餘子，嫡子之母弟。　又國名。【春秋·莊二年】夏公子慶父帥師伐於餘丘。【註】於餘丘，國名。又地名。【左傳·昭二十二年】莒敗齊師于壽餘。　又舟名。【左傳·昭十七年】楚大敗吳師，獲其乗舟餘皇。　又草名。【山海經】招搖山有草，如韭，靑花，名祝餘，食之不飢。　又姓。晉有餘頠，餘文仲。又梁餘、夫餘，俱複姓，見【姓譜】。　又【集韻】余遮切，音耶。【莊子·讓王篇】其緒餘以爲國家。【司馬彪註】緒餘，殘也。緒音奢，餘音耶。　又叶夷周切，音由。

餘字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
餘字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yú］
["Guangyun" is based on all cuts, flat fish, with. ]
"Xie 3" was passed falsely. Traditional characters for "余1".
(1) Food leftovers, extra food.
(2) Unfinished; endless; leftover.
(3) Plenty; ample.
(4) Said to exceed.
(5) Long-term.
(6) Legacy.
(7) Omission.
(8) The rest; others.
(9) At the end; non-essential.
(10) After; after.
(11) Refers to descendants.
(12) Abandonment.
(13) Accumulation. See "Yu Yi Yu San".
(14) Salt.
(15) represents the fraction after the integer. Used after numerals or quantifiers.
(16) Pronouns. Same as "Yu". Represents the first person.
(17) Through "and".
(18) Last name. Wu Youyu Festival in the Spring and Autumn Period. See "Historical Records·Wu Taibo Family".
